catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 772
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: Zodiac calendar with 6 two-sided wooden plaques, decorated with motifs of the 12 animals of the traditional Chinese zodiac (a–f); holder in shape of hanging scroll (g)
markings:
a) recto, LR: Zeshin
b) recto, LRC: Shin | verso, center R edge: Zeshin
d) verso, ULC: (illeg.)
f) recto, center L edge: Zeshin | verso, LRC: Koma
medium: Gold and silver maki-e and shell inlay on lacquered wood
signed:
a) recto: R side: Made on a certain day in 1846 by Ta Zeshin upon request | verso: LRQ,: Zeshin
b) recto, LRC: Drawn by Zeshin | verso, center R edge: Zeshin
c) recto, LRC: Tanyū, copied by Zeshin | verso, bottom center, in sign: Zeshin
d) recto, URQ: Zeshin depicted the spirit | verso, ULC: Tairyūkyo
e) recto, UR edge: Zeshin | verso, : Zeshin
f) recto, center L edge: copy of Minamoto Ōkyo\'s painting, Zeshin | verso, LRC: Zeshin
Signature: Kōka san (1846) natsu hi sei reiya ta Zeshin. (And others.)
title: Zodiac calendar with holder in the shape of a hanging scroll
